content: Content Sourcing with Creative Commons Moz News By: Rand Fishkin March 13, 2005 The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Table of Contents Copied! By: Rand Fishkin March 13, 2005 Content Sourcing with Creative Commons Moz News The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. A great source for content, especially images & tools is the Creative Commons licensing website. The search system enables you to find the content you're seeking and also provides a great outlet for developers looking to contribute. Along with these benefits, your use of the system could earn you a link from their website, a highly trafficked and very powerful inbound link.The Creative Commons partners with many websites, including Flickr, OpenPhoto & FreeMedia to serve media content, and with hundreds of thousands of files in inventory, it's likely you'll find something you like. The only thing they're missing is custom logo design... Copied! Back to Top
